snippet: Michael Huffington, the former California Congressman who spent $28 million of his own money in a 1994 bid for a United States Senate seat, is considering running for governor in 1998, The Los Angeles Times said today.   Mr. Huffington, a Republic...
lead_paragraph: Michael Huffington, the former California Congressman who spent $28 million of his own money in a 1994 bid for a United States Senate seat, is considering running for governor in 1998, The Los Angeles Times said today. Mr. Huffington, a Republican who lost a hard-fought race to the incumbent, Dianne Feinstein, told The Times that he would not use his own money if he ran for governor.
